description: The round payoff this round was 1. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -1000.

The game is structured like a dilemma: while both players have a default cooperative option (option 1) that results in a neutral 0 payoff when both stick to it, opting for option 2 introduces a high-risk, high-reward situation.
The players’ defaults are mutually known—Kate’s default is option 1 and she also knows John’s default is option 1. This shared information sets an expectation of cooperation.

However, the memory from 2024-01-02 shows that when John deviated by choosing option 2, Kate also ended up choosing option 2, resulting in a severe penalty (–1000). This incident illustrates that deviating from default can trigger a mutual escalation, leading to negative outcomes for both players.
